repnme.cdata!:
China - Changchun Water Supply and
            Environmental Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Overall the project is rated
            unsatisfactory. The project's financial objectives were
            only partially achieved: Insofar as the water supply part of
            the project is concerned, the project has achieved most of
            its expected development results. However, the project did
            not achieve its major objectives concerning wastewater
            pollution because of the failure to complete the wastewater
            treatment plant before the project closing date and to
            properly adjust sewerage tariffs as covenanted. Both World
            Bank and Borrower performances were rated deficient overall.
            Notwithstanding this, overall project sustainability is
            rated likely. Key lessons learned include: Design institutes
            for major civil works projects should be selected based on
            relevant experience. The accuracy of final designs should be
            assured using actual soil conditions based on comprehensive
            geological and hydrologic surveys and other relevant
            documents, and then reviewed by experienced consultants.
            This would avoid costly design modifications, implementation
            delays, and expensive change orders. Some other lessons
            were: An unmanageable number of supervision companies should
            be avoided; particular attention should be paid to the past
            experiences of companies in similar projects. Management
            consultants should participate in the decision-making
            process. A project should be nominated as a
            "demonstration project" only after it has been
            completed and proven to meet or exceed expectations, not at
            the time of preparation.

TF026530-TAGPE - ENVIR. TECHNICAL
            ASSISTANCE FUND,TF031601-CHINA - WATER SUPPLY & ENVIRONMENT,UN001010-WATER SUP. & SANIT. FOR THE

18155661.majtheme: Environment and natural resource management,Urban development,Financial and private sector development

repnme.cdata!:
China - Changchun Water Supply and
            Environmental Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The main objectives of the project are
            to improve water supply in Changchun to meet the domestic
            needs of the urban population, support industrial growth,
            and control urban water pollution.  The physical works
            include:  (a) construction of a water transmission pipeline
            to convey water from the Second Songhua River to an
            impounding reservoir currently serving Changchun;
            construction of pumping stations, expansion and improvement
            of water treatment facilities and expansion of the capacity
            of the water distribution system; (b) construction of a
            trunk interceptor sewer and a primary sewage treatment plant
            and procurement of equipment and instruments for
            environmental quality monitoring and control; and (c)
            technical assistance to assist with design and construction
            supervision, to furnish management support to the water and
            sewerage companies including the preparation of a staff
            training program, and to implement a hazardous waste study.
            Institutionally, the project will reinforce the Changchun
            Water Supply Company, develop the Changchun Sewerage
            Company, strengthen water pollution control, establish
            appropriate pricing policies, improve operation practices,
            promote measures for water conservation and improve
            personnel management, including training of staff.

China - Changchun Water Supply and
            Environmental Project
